_comment: This is an annotated example template. Use this as a reference when creating new templates.
_template_id_note: Unique ID using lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only
description: An example template demonstrating all available field types and extraction methods
_description_note: Detailed description helping users understand what this template extracts
_document_type_note: One of: tax-form, invoice, bank-statement, retirement-plan, financial-statement, receipt, other
author: OpenExtract Community
_author_note: Your name, GitHub username, or organization
_tags_note: Keywords to help users find this template

fields._data_type_note: One of: string, integer, currency, date, boolean, decimal, percentage
fields._required_note: If true, extraction fails when field is not found
fields._extraction_method_note: One of: regex, coordinates, table, keyword_proximity
fields._regex_pattern_note: Primary regex pattern. Use capturing group () for the value to extract
fields._fallback_patterns_note: Alternative patterns tried in order if primary fails
fields._validation_note: Optional regex to validate the extracted value
fields._section_note: Document section where field is located (for documentation)

fields._currency_note: For currency fields, the regex should capture the numeric value. $ signs are handled automatically.

fields._date_note: Date fields are automatically parsed and formatted according to output_format.date_format

fields._coordinates_note: Use coordinates when the field is always at a fixed position. Units are points (1/72 inch).

fields._default_value_note: Value used when field is not found and required is false

output_format._csv_headers_note: Order of columns in CSV output. Must match field_name values.
output_format._date_format_note: How dates should be formatted in output. Common: YYYY-MM-DD, MM/DD/YYYY, DD/MM/YYYY
